fields.headline: £2.5bn fall at Friends Provident
fields.bodyText: Stock market falls and other costs have wiped more than £2.5bn off the total funds under management at Friends Provident in six months, it was revealed yesterday. Announcing its interim results, the recently floated life insurer said funds under management fell from £37.4bn on December 31, 2000 to £34.8bn on June 30, with declining stock markets accounting for the bulk of this fall. The company, which floated on July 9, is set to be propelled into the FTSE 100 index. Some 1.7m policyholders received shares as a result of the demutualisation. New business fell 12% to £181.6m in the six months to June 30, with the biggest fall in savings and investment products such as with-profits bonds. After rising before the US terrorist attack, Friends Provident shares ended the day down 26p at 198.5p.
